data.text: @Br0wnBill @PHLPublicHealth They’re going to “reevaluate” and as of March 9 will make a decision to drop masks. But don’t get to excited bc after spring break these weirdos want all school kids back in masks for one week. Can’t let go of the insanity.
@Br0wnBill @PHLPublicHealth Of course not! Poor kids still have to strap a filthy mask on their faces everyday at school. Child abuse!
@PHLPublicHealth I’m confused. “All clear” does that mean masks no longer required in schools?

@MenoDolce @PHLPublicHealth That can't be the explanation. Less than 2 weeks ago, they were tweeting positivity rates in the low 2's. Regardless of data source, there's no way it could have gone up since they should be rolling off older data where the positivity rate was much higher.
@jfazli @PHLPublicHealth We are all clear! Just showed up on their website!

@jfazli @PHLPublicHealth They’re only counting PCR test and not antigen tests. This has been mentioned in a couple articles now.  Of course it is completely stupid as is this entire system they concocted.

@PHLPublicHealth Dr. Bettigole- can you walk us through in the conference how you get the 2.6% and 2.8% positivity rates that have been tweeted out recently? They don't match up to what's on https://t.co/4A5eH048lI nor your charts. Also, they don't make sense relative to last week's tweets. Help!

@PHLPublicHealth More lies or will the health commissioner address the release of #Pfizer 's documents yesterday?
https://t.co/u8N0ho8jFL
